resources.string: 2708 Brooken Hill Drive, Fort Smith, AR

Motivated individual with nearly a decade of self-taught programming experience and a strong problem-solving aptitude. Currently pursuing a Computer Science degree in Software Engineering to complement my technical skills. Proven track record of collaborative teamwork and idea exchange during my nine years at Quantum Plastics. Adept at troubleshooting, programming, and system administration, as evidenced by my three-year involvement in the game modification community, specifically with DayZ. Successfully managed commissioned mods and cultivated a thriving gaming community, showcasing leadership and organizational prowess. Seeking to leverage my analytical mindset, organizational skills, and technical aptitude to excel as a Technical Analyst â€“ Application Development Support at ArcBest, contributing to the company\'s innovative logistics solutions and complex supply chain challenges.

Problem Solving: Modified the game DayZ to create additional features, bug fixes, gameplay balance, and community engagement. Programming: Created dozens of commissioned mods for DayZ working in Enforce Script(C#) programming language. Administration: Managed one of the largest DayZ communities for which I created many of the aspects of the gaming environment. Collaboration: Worked with other community leaders on larger projects.

Supervise operators to maintain production schedule. Work with the production team to achieve production goals. Set up and troubleshoot injection-molding machines to cast products from thermoplastic materials, to meet standard cycle times and quality requirements.
Bachelor of Computer Science - Software Engineering
